news.title: Boeing Dreamliner crash, military escalations darken mood at Paris Air Show
news.summary: Boeing, Airbus and other aerospace giants host parties, sign deals and show off new aircraft. The trade event is a big draw for the industry every year.

news.title: Trump gets his long-sought military parade as protests erupt nationwide
news.summary: "No Kings Day" is a day of protest against President Trump's policies. Demonstrators gathered in Washington, D.C., to voice their opposition to the president.

news.title: Vance Luther Boelter sought in fatal shooting of Minnesota Rep. Melissa Hortman
news.summary: Melissa Hortman and her husband, Mark, were fatally shot in their home outside Minneapolis. Melissa Hortman was a top Minnesota House Democrat.

news.title: Starbucks moves to the next phase in its turnaround: Winning over employees
news.summary: Starbucks CEO Brian Niccol pitched his turnaround strategy to store managers. Niccol was speaking at the company's Leadership Experience in Las Vegas.

news.title: AI is disrupting the advertising business in a big way — industry leaders explain how
news.summary: AI disruption is "unnerving investors in every industry, and it's totally disrupting our business," WPP's outgoing boss Mark Read said.

news.title: Americans spend $10 billion more on Mother’s Day than Father’s Day. What’s going on?
news.summary: When it comes to honoring our parents on their special days, dads appear to be the big loser. Here's why we cheap out on Father’s Day.

news.title: My mother-in-law thought the world’s richest man needed Apple gift cards. How on Earth could she fall for this scam?
news.summary: “Her siblings are all shocked that she would believe this,” her sister says. “Her parents are shocked, too. They’re all shocked.”

news.title: My friend wants me to join in a political protest. I’m worried about my job. Is it OK to say no?
news.summary: “Some of our firm’s clients have a political and economic stake in the issues raised by my friend,” he says.

news.title: ‘It might be another Apple or Microsoft’: My wife invested $100K in one stock and it exploded 1,500%. Do we sell?
news.summary: “She shops with coupons at TJ Maxx,” her mother says. “She’s always been a shopper.”

news.title: ‘I’m 68 and my 401(k) has dwindled to $82,000’: My husband committed financial infidelity and has $50,000 in credit-card debt. What now?
news.summary: “I have $3,000 in gold and Social Security income for me and my spouse makes $46,180 a year.”
